line.en: 'There will be one more meeting before we deliver\nthe parts. I'll let you know before then.'
'OK, thanks An-chan.'
'I'll take you back to the dormitory.'
'No, here's fine. I have some shopping to do for\ndinner anyway.'
'Sure. OK, see you next time.'
'Yeah, thanks An-chan.'
As An-chan's light truck drove away, I stood\nthere, dazed.
It was true that I had to do some shopping but I\ndidn't feel like doing it right away.
While I was wandering around, before I knew it, I\nfound myself at the runway.
A few days ago, we came here to cut the grass, so\nit looks quite tidy, but before that, it was\novergrown with weeds.
Between those weeds, were lines where the soil\nwas exposed.
These were marks from where the wheels of the\nglider had ran over it so many times.
Usually, a glider is launched into the oncoming\nwind.
However, because it was complicated to move the\nwinch which had been positioned there to face the\nwind, we always launched in the same direction.
I stood in the middle of the huge, wide runway,\nand gazed towards the winch.
Memories of the acceleration of being pulled by\nthe tow rope, then floating into the sky, came\nflooding back to me.
As I look up, I see the bright blue sky, and a\ntowering thunderhead.
I envision riding on the wind in the glider.
'I want to fly... in our glider.'
I've been traveling to the airfield for the\npurpose of training.
But flying in the glider that we made... is\ntotally different.
The wind that blows over Kazegaura is not the\nsame as there.
'We will definitely fly again!'
...In this sky!
As I look to the blue sky that field like it's\ndrawing me towards it, I feel energy building up\ninside me.
But in the end, we couldn't find a teacher to act\nas advisor.

To find someone qualified, I tried asking the
people I knew at the airfield that I went to to
get my pilot's license, but there was no one who
could do it.
Even so, we still didn't give up.
Dreaming of the day that we could fly again, we\ncontinued to work on the improvements to the\nglider.
Time passed...
We realized that the cries of the cicadas were\ngetting fewer, and that the end of the summer was\napproaching.
'OK, let's go everyone!'
It was a day in the second term, after the summer\nholiday had ended.
Under a sky which still had the lingering summer\nheat, we headed to the runway.
To fly.
'The day has finally arrived!'
'It came around quicker than I thought it would!'
'It's thanks to all our hard work!'
A teacher who couldn't stand by and ignore us as\nwe carried on our club activities had agreed to\nbecome our advisor.
The summer would soon be over, but...
We're going to fly again!
'Maybe this is like that saying... 'Blind faith\nwill move rocks'... or something like that.'
'It's up to you now, Aoi!'
'Yeah, leave it to me!'
I got my pilot's license for this day.
I climb into the cockpit and wait for the launch\npreparations to be completed.
I look up through the canopy at the sky, which is\nas high as always.
'The runway is clear!'
'Here we go, Aoi!'
We have wings.
We're clumsy so there's no way we can fly by our\nstrength alone.
But...
Let's flap our wings as we head straight forward,\nchasing our dreams!
